text:
Bassett is a city in Allen County, Kansas, United States. It is situated along the Neosho River. In 2010, 14 people lived there.
History.
Bassett was created in 1903. The next year, the Bassett and Concreto extensions were made to the Iola Electric Railroad street car line. In 1914, the first concrete road in Kansas was created in Bassett.
Geography.
Bassett is at (37.904017, -95.408005). The city is east of the Neosho River along the south bank of Elm Creek in Iola Township. It is next to the southern border of the city of Iola (the county seat). Lake Bassola is east of the city. The city is less than two miles southwest of the interchange between U.S. Routes 54 and 169.
The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. Of that, is land and is water.
Weather.
Bassett has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Bassett has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 14 people, 5 households, and 4 families living in Bassett.
